docs.lead_paragraph: The disclosure that Gov. Sarah Palin’s daughter was pregnant was one of several revelations that called into question how well John McCain had screened her.

headline.main: Palin Disclosures Raise Questions on Vetting

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Kate Zernike, Jim Rutenberg and Peter Baker in St. Paul, and Serge F. Kovaleski in Juneau, Alaska.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans rallied around Gov. Sarah Palin, but the disclosure of her teenage daughter’s pregnancy brought uncertainty.

byline.original: By CARL HULSE and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG

docs.lead_paragraph: The 17-year-old daughter of Sarah Palin, John McCain’s running mate, plans to marry the father, according to the campaign.

headline.main: Palin’s Teen Daughter Is Pregnant; New G.O.P. Tumult

docs.snippet: The 17-year-old daughter of Sarah Palin, John McCain’s running mate, plans to marry the father, according to the campaign.

docs.lead_paragraph: ST PAUL, Minn. -- Delegates were drifting, more than strutting, into the convention center past a big outdoor television screen proclaiming a Fox News alert: "Water overtops levees in New Orleans." The unwritten subtext: No escaping Gustav as all news, all the time for the delegates.

headline.main: In St. Paul at the Ghost Town Convention

docs.abstract: The first day of the Republican convention was dominated by the names Gustav and Bristol.
docs.snippet: The first day of the Republican convention was dominated by the names Gustav and Bristol.

docs.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL -- Conservative bloggers struck back today at their left-leaning Web counterparts, blaming them for forcing the family of John McCain's vice-presidential choice, Gov. Sarah Palin, to release the news that their teenage daughter was pregnant. But right-leaning bloggers also used the megaphones of their Web sites to tout the idea -- just as Republicans here at the convention site were doing -- that a teenager giving birth and keeping the baby -- reinforced their anti-abortion, family beliefs. And they seized the news today to attack Senator Barack Obama on his abortion rights views.
docs.abstract: Conservative bloggers spend part of the day dissecting the Palin news and slamming the liberal blogs for a rumor-filled weekend.
docs.snippet: Conservative bloggers spend part of the day dissecting the Palin news and slamming the liberal blogs for a rumor-filled weekend.

docs.lead_paragraph: Like those in the rest of America, people in Alaska were surprised when their governor, Sarah Palin, was named Friday to be Senator John McCain's vice-presidential pick. And Monday morning, the Alaskan delegates gathered in Minneapolis-St. Paul for the Republican National Convention were again caught by surprise, this time by news that Ms. Palin's 17-year-old, unmarried daughter, Bristol, was pregnant.
docs.abstract: Some Alaskan delegates had heard the rumor of Bristol Palin's pregnancy, but were never officially told about it, even as the news broke Monday morning.
docs.snippet: Some Alaskan delegates had heard the rumor of Bristol Palin's pregnancy, but were never officially told about it, even as the news broke Monday morning.

docs.lead_paragraph: As she rose through the ranks of public life in Alaska, Gov. Sarah Palin's discussions about her own pregnancies and the personal lives of her children were often marked by a fierce devotion to her family's privacy, according to her biographer.
docs.abstract: Kaylene Johnson, author of a book about Sarah Palin's life and political career, talks about how the subject of her biography dealt with questions about her family life.
docs.snippet: Kaylene Johnson, author of a book about Sarah Palin's life and political career, talks about how the subject of her biography dealt with questions about her family life.
